skills.name: Identify the number of rows, columns and squares in rectangles partitioned into equal squares

explanations.A: This has only been split into rows... Remember squares have equal sides!
explanations.B: This has only been split into columns... Remember squares have equal sides!
explanations.C: This has been split into equal columns AND equal rows so is therefore, split into squares!
explanations.D: Remember squares have equal sides and 4 right angles!

explanations.A: This has been split in half... Remember squares have equal sides and 4 right angles!
explanations.B: This has been split into equal columns AND equal rows so is therefore, split into squares!
explanations.C: This has only been split into columns... Remember squares have equal sides!
explanations.D: This has only been split into rows... Remember squares have equal sides!

explanations.A: Rows are the horizontal sections, counting down we have 1, 2, 3!
explanations.B: You have accidentally counted the number of columns... Remember a row is a horizontal section!
explanations.C: I think you have added the number of rows to the number of columns. Remember a row is a horizontal section!
explanations.D: This is the number of squares, the question wants the number of rows so, the number of horizontal sections...

explanations.A: This is the number of squares, the question wants the number of rows so, the number of horizontal sections...
explanations.B: You have accidentally counted the number of columns... Remember a row is a horizontal section!
explanations.C: Rows are the horizontal sections, counting down we have 1, 2!
explanations.D: I think you have added the number of rows to the number of columns. Remember a row is a horizontal section!

explanations.A: You have accidentally counted the number of rows... Remember a column is a vertical section!
explanations.B: Columns are the vertical sections, counting across we have 1, 2, 3, 4, 5!
explanations.C: I think you have added the number of rows to the number of columns. Remember a column is a vertical section!
explanations.D: This is the number of squares, the question wants the number of columns so, the number of vertical sections...

explanations.A: I think you have added the number of rows to the number of columns. Remember a column is a vertical section!
explanations.B: This is the number of squares, the question wants the number of columns so, the number of vertical sections...
explanations.C: You have accidentally counted the number of rows... Remember a column is a vertical section!
explanations.D: Columns are the vertical sections, counting across we have 1, 2, 3, 4!

explanations.A: You have accidentally counted the number of rows... How many SQUARES are there?
explanations.B: You have accidentally counted the number of columns... How many SQUARES are there?
explanations.C: I think you have accidentally added the number of columns and rows but to find the total number of squares we need to multiply them!
explanations.D: We have 5 columns with 3 rows so we have 15 squares in total!

explanations.A: We have 4 columns with 2 rows so we have 8 squares in total!
explanations.B: You have accidentally counted the number of rows... How many SQUARES are there?
explanations.C: You have accidentally counted the number of columns... How many SQUARES are there?
explanations.D: I think you have accidentally added the number of columns and rows but to find the total number of squares we need to multiply them!

explanations.A: I think you have confused columns and rows... Rows are horizontal sections and columns are vertical!
explanations.B: Looking at the diagram we can see there are 4 rows, the horizontal sections, 2 columns, the vertical sections, and therefore, 4 x 2 = 8, 8 squares. So, only Katie is correct!
explanations.C: Rows and columns are not interchangeable. Both have the correct number of squares but who has correctly identified the number of rows and columns?
explanations.D: At least one of them is correct... Rows are horizontal sections and columns are vertical! Use this to see who has counted the rows and columns correctly

explanations.A: Looking at the diagram we can see there are 3 rows, the horizontal sections, 4 columns, the vertical sections, and therefore, 3 x 4 = 12, 12 squares. So, only Tom is correct!
explanations.B: I think you have confused columns and rows... Rows are horizontal sections and columns are vertical!
explanations.C: Rows and columns are not interchangeable. Both have the correct number of squares but who has correctly identified the number of rows and columns?
explanations.D: At least one of them is correct... Rows are horizontal sections and columns are vertical! Use this to see who has counted the rows and columns correctly
